intro: Canavalia haleakalaensis, commonly known as Haleakala morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. It produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
